Package org.dellroad.jct.jshell

Class LocalContextExecutionControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • jdk.jshell.execution.DirectExecutionControl
      • jdk.jshell.execution.LocalExecutionControl
        • org.dellroad.jct.jshell.LocalContextExecutionControl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, ExecutionControl
    public class LocalContextExecutionControl
extends LocalExecutionControl
    A LocalExecutionControl that provides the ability to add thread-local context to the execution of each JShell snippet and its subsequent result decoding into a String.

    It is sometimes useful to have the execution of JShell snippets occur within some thread-local context. For example, a database application might want to open a transaction around each snippet execution. This is somewhat tricky because JShell's LocalExecutionControl executes snippets in a different thread from the main command loop thread so, for example, using clientCodeEnter() and clientCodeLeave() won't work.

    In addition, context may also be necessary during the conversion of the snippet result into a String for display in the JShell console. This conversion is performed by DirectExecutionControl.valueString(java.lang.Object) and is normally done later, in a separate thread. This class performs this conversion earlier, in the same thread that executes the snippet, while the context is still available.

    The methods a subclass can use to bracket snippet execution and String result decoding are enterContext() and #leaveContext leaveContext().

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        protected String invoke​(Method method)
                 throws Exception
        Overrides:
        invoke in class LocalExecutionControl
        Throws:
        Exception

      • enterContext

        protected void enterContext()
        Open a new thread-local context for snippet execution.

        The implementation in LocalContextExecutionControl does nothing.

      • leaveContext

        protected void leaveContext​(boolean success)
        Close the thread-local context previously opened by enterContext() in the current thread.

        The implementation in LocalContextExecutionControl does nothing.

        Parameters:
        success - true if snippet execution was successful, false if an exception occurred

      • invokeWithContext

        protected Object invokeWithContext​(Method method)
                            throws Throwable
        Execute the given snippet in context.

        The implementation in LocalContextExecutionControl uses enterContext() and leaveContext() to bracket the execution of the snippet and the decoding of its result (via decodeWithContext()). The decoded result is wrapped in a StringWrapper to prevent duplicate decoding by JShell.

        Parameters:
        method - static snippet method
        Returns:
        result from snippet execution
        Throws:
        Throwable

      • decodeWithContext

        protected String decodeWithContext​(Object result)
        Decode the snippet result into a String for display in the JShell console.

        The implementation in LocalContextExecutionControl just invokes DirectExecutionControl.valueString(java.lang.Object).

      • invokeWrapper

        public static Object invokeWrapper()
                            throws Throwable
        Invocation wrapper method.

        This method recovers the current instance and the actual method to invoke from our internal secret mapping and then delegates to invokeWithContext().

        This method is only used internally but is required to be public due to Java access controls.

        Returns:
        result from snippet execution
        Throws:
        Throwable
